context: This controversy surrounding the issue thus implies the need for further studies on MTBE exposure and its related health effects. Meanwhile, benzene is a known carcinogen such as leukemia (IARC, 1987; USEPA, 1990). Toluene is neurotoxic (Amess, 1995; Liu and Fechter, 1997). According to the Korean Petroleum Corporation, the gasoline manufactured by all five Korean petroleum companies contains 6–8% MTBE, 1–3% benzene and 10–12% toluene by volume. This study was conducted to examine the in-vehicle exposure of passenger car and public bus commuters to MTBE, benzene and toluene in Taegu, Korea, while focusing on four factors (transportation mode, passenger-car type, commute period and commute season) that may influence the amount of in-vehicle exposure. Unlike the previous in-vehicle VOC exposure studies, the present investigation was conducted using actual commute routes. According to the Korean news media, some spurious gasoline, typically manufactured by mixing toluene with the solvent used in paint manufacturing (50/50 by volume), was being illegally sold in the study area.
